summary: The document is a confidential CIA information report from April 25, 1963, focusing on Viet Cong activities in the Saigon-Cholon-Gia Dinh Special Zone of South Vietnam. It outlines the Viet Cong's intentions to escalate terrorist and military subversion efforts, specifically targeting Americans. Additionally, it notes the suspension of counterpropaganda activities and the expected reassignment of personnel to military subversion roles.
key_findings: The Viet Cong intended to increase terrorist and military subversion activities in the Saigon-Cholon-Gia Dinh Special Zone starting early April 1963.
Americans were the primary targets of these planned operations.
Counterpropaganda activities were halted, with personnel awaiting transfer to military subversion organizations.
The report is marked confidential, prohibiting foreign dissemination.
